intro: Tetrapterys heteroalata, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a tropical plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that are covered in fine, soft hairs, giving it a velvety texture. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that are typically clustered in axillary inflorescences. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, round seeds. Tetrapterys heteroalata is often found in disturbed habitats and is considered an invasive species in some regions.
